text: As soon as they were gone , Elizabeth walked out to recover her spirits ; or , in other words , to dwell without interruption on those subjects which must deaden them more . Mr. Darcy ’s behaviour astonished and vexed her .

text: “ I must go instantly to my mother , ” she cried .

text: She then hastened away to her mother , who had purposely broken up the card - party , and was sitting upstairs with Kitty .

text: Elizabeth , who was left by herself , now smiled at the rapidity and ease with which an affair was finally settled , that had given them so many previous months of suspense and vexation . “ And this , ” said she , “ is the end of all his friend ’s anxious circumspection ! of all his sister ’s falsehood and contrivance !

text: the happiest , wisest , and most reasonable end ! ”

text: In a few minutes she was joined by Bingley , whose conference with her father had been short and to the purpose .
text_tokenized: In a few minutes she was joined by Bingley , whose conference with her father had been short and to the purpose .

text: “ Where is your sister ? ” said he hastily , as he opened the door .
text_tokenized: “ Where is your sister ? ” said he hastily , as he opened the door .

text: “ With my mother upstairs .
text_tokenized: “ With my mother upstairs .

text: She will be down in a moment , I dare say . ”
text_tokenized: She will be down in a moment , I dare say . ”

text: He then shut the door , and , coming up to her , claimed the good wishes and affection of a sister .
text_tokenized: He then shut the door , and , coming up to her , claimed the good wishes and affection of a sister .

text: Elizabeth honestly and heartily expressed her delight in the prospect of their relationship .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth honestly and heartily expressed her delight in the prospect of their relationship .

text: They shook hands with great cordiality ; and then , till her sister came down , she had to listen to all he had to say of his own happiness , and of Jane ’s perfections ; and in spite of his being a lover , Elizabeth really believed all his expectations of felicity to be rationally founded , because they had for basis the excellent understanding and super - excellent disposition of Jane , and a general similarity of feeling and taste between her and himself .
text_tokenized: They shook hands with great cordiality ; and then , till her sister came down , she had to listen to all he had to say of his own happiness , and of Jane ’s perfections ; and in spite of his being a lover , Elizabeth really believed all his expectations of felicity to be rationally founded , because they had for basis the excellent understanding and super - excellent disposition of Jane , and a general similarity of feeling and taste between her and himself .

text: It was an evening of no common delight to them all ; the satisfaction of Miss Bennet ’s mind gave such a glow of sweet animation to her face , as made her look handsomer than ever .
text_tokenized: It was an evening of no common delight to them all ; the satisfaction of Miss Bennet ’s mind gave such a glow of sweet animation to her face , as made her look handsomer than ever .

text: Kitty simpered and smiled , and hoped her turn was coming soon .

text: Mrs. Bennet could not give her consent , or speak her approbation in terms warm enough to satisfy her feelings , though she talked to Bingley of nothing else , for half an hour ; and when Mr. Bennet joined them at supper , his voice and manner plainly showed how really happy he was .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Bennet could not give her consent , or speak her approbation in terms warm enough to satisfy her feelings , though she talked to Bingley of nothing else , for half an hour ; and when Mr. Bennet joined them at supper , his voice and manner plainly showed how really happy he was .

text: Not a word , however , passed his lips in allusion to it , till their visitor took his leave for the night ; but as soon as he was gone , he turned to his daughter and said,-- “ Jane , I congratulate you .
text_tokenized: Not a word , however , passed his lips in allusion to it , till their visitor took his leave for the night ; but as soon as he was gone , he turned to his daughter and said,-- “ Jane , I congratulate you .

text: You will be a very happy woman . ”
text_tokenized: You will be a very happy woman . ”

text: Jane went to him instantly , kissed him , and thanked him for his goodness .
text_tokenized: Jane went to him instantly , kissed him , and thanked him for his goodness .

text: “ You are a good girl , ” he replied , “ and I have great pleasure in thinking you will be so happily settled .
text_tokenized: “ You are a good girl , ” he replied , “ and I have great pleasure in thinking you will be so happily settled .

text: I have not a doubt of your doing very well together .
text_tokenized: I have not a doubt of your doing very well together .

text: Your tempers are by no means unlike .
text_tokenized: Your tempers are by no means unlike .

text: You are each of you so complying , that nothing will ever be resolved on ; so easy , that every servant will cheat you ; and so generous , that you will always exceed your income . ” “ I hope not so .
text_tokenized: You are each of you so complying , that nothing will ever be resolved on ; so easy , that every servant will cheat you ; and so generous , that you will always exceed your income . ” “ I hope not so .

text: Imprudence or thoughtlessness in money matters would be unpardonable in _ me _ . ”
text_tokenized: Imprudence or thoughtlessness in money matters would be unpardonable in _ me _ . ”

text: “ Exceed their income !
text_tokenized: “ Exceed their income !

text: My dear Mr. Bennet , ” cried his wife , “ what are you talking of ?
text_tokenized: My dear Mr. Bennet , ” cried his wife , “ what are you talking of ?

text: Why , he has four or five thousand a year , and very likely more . ”
text_tokenized: Why , he has four or five thousand a year , and very likely more . ”

text: Then addressing her daughter , “ Oh , my dear , dear Jane , I am so happy !
text_tokenized: Then addressing her daughter , “ Oh , my dear , dear Jane , I am so happy !

text: I am sure I sha n’t get a wink of sleep all night .
text_tokenized: I am sure I sha n’t get a wink of sleep all night .

text: I always said it must be so , at last .
text_tokenized: I always said it must be so , at last .

text: I was sure you could not be so beautiful for nothing !
text_tokenized: I was sure you could not be so beautiful for nothing !

text: I remember , as soon as ever I saw him , when he first came into Hertfordshire last year , I thought how likely it was that you should come together .
text_tokenized: I remember , as soon as ever I saw him , when he first came into Hertfordshire last year , I thought how likely it was that you should come together .

text: Oh , he is the handsomest young man that ever was seen ! ”
text_tokenized: Oh , he is the handsomest young man that ever was seen ! ”

text: Wickham , Lydia , were all forgotten .
text_tokenized: Wickham , Lydia , were all forgotten .

text: Jane was beyond competition her favourite child .

text: At that moment she cared for no other .

text: Her younger sisters soon began to make interest with her for objects of happiness which she might in future be able to dispense .

text: Mary petitioned for the use of the library at Netherfield ; and Kitty begged very hard for a few balls there every winter .

text: Bingley , from this time , was of course a daily visitor at Longbourn ; coming frequently before breakfast , and always remaining till after supper ; unless when some barbarous neighbour , who could not be enough detested , had given him an invitation to dinner , which he thought himself obliged to accept .

text: Elizabeth had now but little time for conversation with her sister ; for while he was present Jane had no attention to bestow on anyone else : but she found herself considerably useful to both of them , in those hours of separation that must sometimes occur .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth had now but little time for conversation with her sister ; for while he was present Jane had no attention to bestow on anyone else : but she found herself considerably useful to both of them , in those hours of separation that must sometimes occur .

text: In the absence of Jane , he always attached himself to Elizabeth for the pleasure of talking of her ; and when Bingley was gone , Jane constantly sought the same means of relief .
text_tokenized: In the absence of Jane , he always attached himself to Elizabeth for the pleasure of talking of her ; and when Bingley was gone , Jane constantly sought the same means of relief .

text: “ He has made me so happy , ” said she , one evening , “ by telling me that he was totally ignorant of my being in town last spring !
text_tokenized: “ He has made me so happy , ” said she , one evening , “ by telling me that he was totally ignorant of my being in town last spring !

text: I had not believed it possible . ”
text_tokenized: I had not believed it possible . ”

text: “ I suspected as much , ” replied Elizabeth .
text_tokenized: “ I suspected as much , ” replied Elizabeth .

text: “ But how did he account for it ? ”
text_tokenized: “ But how did he account for it ? ”

text: “ It must have been his sisters ’ doing .
text_tokenized: “ It must have been his sisters ’ doing .

text: They were certainly no friends to his acquaintance with me , which I can not wonder at , since he might have chosen so much more advantageously in many respects .
text_tokenized: They were certainly no friends to his acquaintance with me , which I can not wonder at , since he might have chosen so much more advantageously in many respects .

text: But when they see , as I trust they will , that their brother is happy with me , they will learn to be contented , and we shall be on good terms again : though we can never be what we once were to each other . ”
text_tokenized: But when they see , as I trust they will , that their brother is happy with me , they will learn to be contented , and we shall be on good terms again : though we can never be what we once were to each other . ”

text: “ That is the most unforgiving speech , ” said Elizabeth , “ that I ever heard you utter .

text: Good girl !
text_tokenized: Good girl !

text: It would vex me , indeed , to see you again the dupe of Miss Bingley ’s pretended regard . ”
text_tokenized: It would vex me , indeed , to see you again the dupe of Miss Bingley ’s pretended regard . ”

text: “ Would you believe it , Lizzy , that when he went to town last November he really loved me , and nothing but a persuasion of _ my _ being indifferent would have prevented his coming down again ? ” “ He made a little mistake , to be sure ; but it is to the credit of his modesty . ”

text: This naturally introduced a panegyric from Jane on his diffidence , and the little value he put on his own good qualities .
text_tokenized: This naturally introduced a panegyric from Jane on his diffidence , and the little value he put on his own good qualities .

text: Elizabeth was pleased to find that he had not betrayed the interference of his friend ; for , though Jane had the most generous and forgiving heart in the world , she knew it was a circumstance which must prejudice her against him .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth was pleased to find that he had not betrayed the interference of his friend ; for , though Jane had the most generous and forgiving heart in the world , she knew it was a circumstance which must prejudice her against him .

text: “ I am certainly the most fortunate creature that ever existed ! ” cried Jane .
text_tokenized: “ I am certainly the most fortunate creature that ever existed ! ” cried Jane .

text: “ Oh , Lizzy , why am I thus singled from my family , and blessed above them all ? If I could but see you as happy !
text_tokenized: “ Oh , Lizzy , why am I thus singled from my family , and blessed above them all ? If I could but see you as happy !

text: If there were but such another man for you ! ”
text_tokenized: If there were but such another man for you ! ”

text: “ If you were to give me forty such men I never could be so happy as you .
text_tokenized: “ If you were to give me forty such men I never could be so happy as you .

text: Till I have your disposition , your goodness , I never can have your happiness .
text_tokenized: Till I have your disposition , your goodness , I never can have your happiness .

text: No , no , let me shift for myself ; and , perhaps , if I have very good luck , I may meet with another Mr. Collins in time .
text_tokenized: No , no , let me shift for myself ; and , perhaps , if I have very good luck , I may meet with another Mr. Collins in time .

text: The situation of affairs in the Longbourn family could not be long a secret .

text: Mrs. Bennet was privileged to whisper it to Mrs. Philips , and she ventured , without any permission , to do the same by all her neighbours in Meryton .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Bennet was privileged to whisper it to Mrs. Philips , and she ventured , without any permission , to do the same by all her neighbours in Meryton .

text: The Bennets were speedily pronounced to be the luckiest family in the world ; though only a few weeks before , when Lydia had first run away , they had been generally proved to be marked out for misfortune .
